topRisks: SMS functionality requires third-party integration and external account management.
Segmentation by 'location' is not explicitly supported in the current broadcast tool.
Accessibility compliance for contrast levels needs verification against WCAG standards.
General error handling and user guidance details are limited in the capability brief.
nextActions: Confirm third-party SMS provider compatibility and setup requirements.
Verify if 'location' can be mapped to a custom field for segmentation.
Conduct a contrast audit of the web UI to ensure full accessibility compliance.
Review error handling documentation to provide specific examples of user guidance.
proofNotes: ReliefRoster covers the majority of functional requirements out-of-the-box.
SMS and specific segmentation (location) require minor configuration or third-party integration.
Accessibility and error handling details are partially documented and require further verification.
Proof verifier checks evidenceQuotes against the Capability Brief text (normalized matching; ellipsis wildcard supported).
The "Evidence mismatch" flag is verifier-owned and is only added/removed by the proof verifier.
Proof totals count unpaired evidence IDs (IDs without quotes) as unverified references (conservative scoring).

requirements.text: The system shall support volunteer registration with configurable form fields.
requirements.responseSummary: ReliefRoster provides web-based volunteer registration with configurable form fields and validation.
evidenceQuotes: ReliefRoster provides web-based volunteer registration with configurable form fields and required/optional validation.

requirements.text: The system shall allow coordinators to create events and define shifts with capacity limits.
requirements.responseSummary: Coordinators can easily create events and define shifts with specific capacity limits.
evidenceQuotes: Coordinators can create events and define shifts with capacity limits.

requirements.text: The system shall allow volunteers to sign up for shifts and receive confirmations.
requirements.responseSummary: Volunteers can self-signup for shifts and receive automated email confirmations.
evidenceQuotes: volunteers can self-signup for available shifts.
Automated email confirmations and reminders are supported.

requirements.text: The system shall send automated reminders 24 hours and 2 hours before a shift via email.
requirements.responseSummary: The platform supports automated email reminders with configurable schedules, including 24-hour and 2-hour intervals.
evidenceQuotes: Automated email confirmations and reminders are supported with configurable schedules (e.g., 24h, 2h).

requirements.text: The system shall support optional SMS reminders (if enabled by the organization).
requirements.responseSummary: SMS reminders are supported via integration with a third-party provider, provided the organization supplies the account.
evidenceQuotes: SMS reminders are not included by default; integration is possible via a third-party SMS provider if the organization supplies an account.
gapsOrQuestions: Which third-party SMS providers are supported?
Is there a preferred provider for the organization?

requirements.text: The system shall allow coordinators to mark attendance and record no-shows.
requirements.responseSummary: Attendance tracking is built-in, allowing coordinators to mark attendance and record no-shows for each shift.
evidenceQuotes: Attendance tracking is supported for each shift, including notes and no-show marking.

requirements.text: The system shall maintain a volunteer profile including languages, skills, certifications, and availability.
requirements.responseSummary: Volunteer profiles comprehensively track skills, language preferences, certifications, and availability notes.
evidenceQuotes: Volunteer profiles support skills, language preference, certifications, and availability notes.

requirements.text: The system shall support role-based access (Admin, Coordinator, Volunteer).
requirements.responseSummary: ReliefRoster includes native support for Admin, Coordinator, and Volunteer roles.
evidenceQuotes: Role-based access is supported with Admin, Coordinator, and Volunteer roles.

requirements.text: The system shall provide a bilingual messaging option (English/Spanish) for templates.
requirements.responseSummary: Messaging templates can be authored in both English and Spanish, with coordinators selecting the language per send.
evidenceQuotes: Messaging templates can be authored in English and Spanish; coordinators can choose the template language per send.

requirements.text: The system shall provide a dashboard showing registered volunteers, shift fill rates, attendance/no-show rates, and hours.
requirements.responseSummary: The dashboard provides real-time visibility into volunteer counts, fill rates, attendance metrics, and total hours.
evidenceQuotes: Dashboards include volunteer counts, fill rates, attendance rate, and volunteer hours by event.

requirements.text: The system shall support CSV export of volunteer rosters, schedules, and attendance logs.
requirements.responseSummary: All critical data including rosters, schedules, and attendance logs can be exported to CSV format.
evidenceQuotes: CSV export is supported for rosters, schedules, and attendance logs.

requirements.text: The system shall allow coordinators to broadcast announcements to selected volunteer segments (by skill/language/location).
requirements.responseSummary: Broadcasting is supported for skill and language segments, but location-based segmentation is not explicitly mentioned.
evidenceQuotes: Coordinators can broadcast announcements to volunteer segments (by skill and language preference).
gapsOrQuestions: Can location be captured as a custom skill or field for segmentation?

requirements.text: The system shall provide a basic audit log of coordinator actions (event created, shift edited, message sent).
requirements.responseSummary: The system maintains an audit log of key coordinator actions including event management and messaging.
evidenceQuotes: Coordinator actions are recorded in an audit log (event creation/editing and message sends).

requirements.text: The system shall support data retention settings (e.g., delete inactive volunteer records after X months).
requirements.responseSummary: Configurable data retention rules allow organizations to manage inactive volunteer records automatically.
evidenceQuotes: Data retention rules can be configured for inactive volunteers (organization chooses retention period).

requirements.text: The system shall provide accessibility considerations for web UI (keyboard navigation and readable contrast).
requirements.responseSummary: The UI supports keyboard navigation for key workflows, but specific contrast ratio compliance is not detailed.
evidenceQuotes: UI supports mobile browsers and includes keyboard navigation for key workflows.
gapsOrQuestions: Does the UI meet WCAG 2.1 Level AA contrast requirements?

requirements.text: The platform shall be accessible via modern browsers on desktop and mobile.
requirements.responseSummary: ReliefRoster is a web-based platform that fully supports modern desktop and mobile browsers.
evidenceQuotes: UI supports mobile browsers and includes keyboard navigation for key workflows.

requirements.text: The platform shall support at least 2,000 registered volunteers.
requirements.responseSummary: The platform is designed to support up to 5,000 volunteers, exceeding the requirement.
evidenceQuotes: ReliefRoster is designed for organizations up to ~5,000 volunteers on standard deployment.

requirements.text: The platform shall provide basic error handling and clear user guidance.
requirements.responseSummary: The system includes field validation for registration, though broader error handling details are not specified.
evidenceQuotes: ReliefRoster provides web-based volunteer registration with... required/optional validation.
gapsOrQuestions: Can you provide examples of error messages for invalid shift sign-ups?

requirements.text: The platform shall ensure that exported data can be downloaded without additional tools.
requirements.responseSummary: Data is exported in CSV format, which is a standard format accessible without specialized software.
evidenceQuotes: CSV export is supported for rosters, schedules, and attendance logs.

proposalOutline.executiveSummary: ReliefRoster is a purpose-built platform for volunteer coordination, offering robust registration, scheduling, and bilingual communication tools. Our solution directly addresses RapidRelief Network's goals of reducing onboarding time and improving shift reliability through automated reminders and comprehensive reporting.
sections: Solution Overview: ReliefRoster for Disaster Relief
evidenceVerificationNotes: All 'Covered' statuses are directly supported by CB-xx statements.
Partial statuses indicate where the Capability Brief is silent on specific sub-requirements (e.g., location-based segmentation).
